idCitation.resTitle: Local Responsibility Area Fire Hazard Severity Zones (FHSZLRA25_Phase2_v1) February 24, 2025

citRespParty.rpOrgName: Fire Hazard Severity Zone Team, CAL FIRE

dataIdInfo.idAbs: Fire Hazard Severity Zone classes from the map dated February 24, 2025.
dataIdInfo.idPurp:
Under the purpose of fire safety and prevention, and by statutory authority, The State Fire Marshal shall classify lands within Local Responsibility Areas (LRA) into fire hazard severity zones. Each zone shall embrace relatively homogeneous lands and shall be based on fuel loading, slope, fire weather, and other relevant factors present, including areas where winds have been identified by the department as a major cause of wildfire spread.
The California laws and regulations associated with Fire Hazard Severity Zones in LRA are found in California Government Code 51175-51189, and describe the objectives and and processes by which these data are developed, transmitted as a recommendation to local government agencies, and the subsequent required local ordinance adoption and documentation processes to see the zones finalized.
Delivery of Recommended LRA FHSZ data and maps is being phased by regional areas of the state. This data set represents Phase 2 or the process, and includes the following counties:[Alameda, Contra Costa, Del Norte, Humboldt, Marin, Mendocino, Merced, Napa, San Francisco, San Joaquin, San Mateo, Santa Clara, Santa Cruz, Solano, Sonoma, Stanislaus, Yolo] Details on the planned schedule and an index to all phase areas can be found at website.
dataIdInfo.idCredit: Datasets from numerous sources were used in the modeling process.

Consts.useLimit: The State of California and the Department of Forestry and Fire Protection make no representations or warranties regarding the accuracy of data or maps. Neither the State nor the Department shall be liable under any circumstances for any direct, special, incidental, or consequential damages with respect to any claim by any user or third party on account of, or arising from, the use of data or maps.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: The type of entity responsible for fire protection.
attr.attrdefs: California Department of Forestry and Fire Protection

edom.edomvds: California Department of Forestry and Fire Protection

attr.attrdef: A numerical code that can be used to identify the corresponding Fire Hazard Severity Zone . -3 = Unzoned, Non Wildland 1 = Moderate Fire Hazard Severity Zone 2 = High Fire Hazard Severity Zone 3 = Very High Fire Hazard Severity Zone
Area of feature in internal units squared.

attrdomv.udom: Positive real numbers that are automatically generated.
